name: Chicken and Sweet Potato Bake
description: A hearty and healthy baked dish combining tender chicken and sweet potatoes with a touch of rosemary. Perfect comfort food for those cold evenings or easy bake when entertaining.

ingredients.item: skinless chicken thigh fillets, each cut in half
lemons, 1 juiced and 1 cut into wedges to serve

instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cube sweet potatoes un 2cm cubes and cut red onions into wedges.
Add sweet potatoes and red onions to tray and season with olive oil, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Toss everything together. Roast for 15 minutes.
Take tray out of oven and give veg a mix. Add chicken pieces, drizzle with 1/2 tsp of oil. Squeeze over lemon juice and add paprika. Return to oven for 15 mins.
Add broccoli to tray and pour over most of the chicken stock. Roast for final 15-20 mins (topping up stock if needed).

name: Creamy Chicken and Mushroom Pasta
description: A flavorful pasta dish featuring tender chicken and golden mushrooms in a creamy parmesan sauce, enhanced with garlic, rosemary, and a hint of lemon.
instructions: Cook pasta in salted water until al dente, reserving some pasta water before draining.
Season chicken thighs with salt, pepper, and optional flour. Sear in olive oil until golden and cooked through, then set aside.
In the same skillet, toast mushrooms in butter over medium heat until golden brown. Add garlic and rosemary, cooking briefly until fragrant.
Deglaze the pan with white wine, simmering until reduced. Stir in cream, followed by parmesan in batches, letting it melt into the sauce.
Combine the cooked pasta, chicken, and parsley with the sauce. Simmer gently to thicken before serving with a final squeeze of lemon.

name: Pork Teriyaki with Rice and Broccoli
description: A quick and flavorful stir-fry featuring tender pork, broccoli, and teriyaki sauce served over rice, perfect for a weeknight meal.

ingredients.item: pork loin steaks, trimmed and cut into strips

instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium-high heat.
Coat pork strips with cornflour and fry for 3-4 minutes until golden and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
Add broccoli and red pepper to the pan. Stir-fry for 5-6 minutes until tender-crisp.
Stir in teriyaki sauce and water, bringing the mixture to a simmer.
Return pork to the pan, tossing to coat in the sauce. Cook for 2 more minutes.
Serve over cooked jasmine rice.

name: Easy Chicken Curry
description: A simple and flavorful chicken curry enriched with creamy yogurt, perfect for family dinners.
instructions: Heat the oil in a deep frying pan over medium heat and cook the onion for 5 minutes until softened.
Add the garlic and ginger, cooking for an additional minute.
Stir in the curry paste and cook for 2 minutes.
Add the chopped tomatoes and sugar, then season with salt. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.
Add the chicken pieces, ensuring they are submerged in the sauce. Simmer for 15 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through.
Remove from heat and stir in the yogurt and most of the coriander.
Serve the curry over cooked rice with naan bread on the side, garnished with the remaining coriander.

name: Spaghetti alla Carbonara
description: A classic Italian pasta dish featuring spaghetti tossed in a creamy sauce made from eggs, Parmesan cheese, and pancetta.

ingredients.item: salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the spaghetti until al dente.
While the pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat and add the diced pancetta. Cook until crispy, then remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and grated Parmesan cheese.
Once the pasta is done, reserve a cup of the pasta water and drain the rest.

Quickly add the hot pasta to the skillet with the pancetta. Pour in the egg and cheese mixture, tossing rapidly to create a creamy sauce. If the mixture is too thick, add some reserved pasta water to achieve the desired consistency.
Season with freshly ground black pepper and serve immediately.

name: Pesto Pasta
description: A simple and flavorful pasta dish tossed with homemade basil pesto sauce.
instructions: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and transfer to a large bowl.
Combine basil leaves, Parmesan cheese, olive oil, pine nuts, garlic, salt, and black pepper in a food processor; blend until smooth.
Pour pesto over the pasta and toss to coat.

name: Avocado Egg Salad
description: A creamy and nutritious twist on the classic egg salad, incorporating ripe avocados and fresh herbs for enhanced flavor and health benefits.
instructions: Place the eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil, then remove from heat, cover, and let sit for 12 minutes.
Transfer the eggs to an ice water bath to cool, then peel and chop them.
In a mixing bowl, combine the chopped eggs, diced avocados, mayonnaise, chives, parsley, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Gently stir until all ingredients are well combined.
Serve immediately on bread, lettuce leaves, or as desired.

name: Butternut Squash Soup
description: A creamy and nourishing soup made with roasted butternut squash, fresh herbs, and ginger, capturing the essence of fall in every spoonful.
instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and a pinch of salt, and sauté until translucent.
Add the cubed butternut squash and cook until it begins to soften.
Stir in the minced garlic, ginger, sage, and rosemary, and cook for a minute until fragrant.
Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and let it simmer until the squash is tender, about 20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. Alternatively, transfer the soup in batches to a blender and blend until smooth.
Season with additional salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley and pepitas if desired.

name: Best Ever Tiramisu
description: A classic Italian dessert featuring layers of coffee-soaked sponge fingers, creamy mascarpone, and a dusting of cocoa powder.
instructions: Mix the cooled coffee with the Marsala wine in a shallow dish.
Whisk the egg yolks and sugar together until pale and thick.
Beat in the mascarpone until smooth.
In a separate bowl, whisk the egg whites until stiff peaks form.
In another bowl, whip the double cream until thick.
Gently fold the whipped cream and egg whites into the mascarpone mixture.
Dip each sponge finger into the coffee mixture for a couple of seconds, then layer them in a dish.
Spread half the mascarpone mixture over the soaked sponge fingers.
Repeat the layers with the remaining sponge fingers and mascarpone mixture.
Cover and chill in the fridge for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.
Before serving, dust with cocoa powder and sprinkle with grated dark chocolate if desired.
